intro: Chrysanthellum rosei, commonly known as the rose-flowered chrysanthellum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Chrysanthellum rosei is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
